pageTitle: Prime Minister’s itinerary for Wednesday, June 30, 2021 | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Note: All times local

Ottawa, Ontario

Private meetings.

11:20 a.m. The Prime Minister will make an announcement and deliver remarks during the Generation Equality Forum.

The event will be streamed online at http://webtv.un.org.

Media and viewers are invited to register for the event via the following link: https://forumgenerationegalite.fr/en/get-involved/register.

2:00 p.m. The Prime Minister will hold a media availability on investing in affordable housing, followed by a visit to a construction site at Shepherds of Good Hope’s Hope Living Residence, a supportive housing program in Kanata, Ontario. He will be joined by the Minister of Families, Children and Social Development Ahmed Hussen and the Mayor of Ottawa Jim Watson.

Hope Living Residence
145 Castlefrank Road

Notes for media:

  • Open coverage
  • Media are asked to arrive no later than 1:15 p.m.

7:30 p.m. The Prime Minister will deliver remarks and take part in a conversation with the Prime Minister of Portugal, António Costa, as part of a virtual event celebrating Portuguese Heritage Month in Canada.
